item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: Bounty
item.description:
RopeStringFace:

I have to go eat. If you make a reply and I don’t reply for awhile, don’t take it as a win for yourself.

I don’t know why you have this kind of attitude while trying to suggest a class. This is not a competition of who’s right and who’s wrong, this is not that kind of forum. There is an edit button at the top right corner that you can use when you’re wrong~…

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: í42-Xblade
item.description:
ThePlex:

No, the rules for Gamethrowing will NEVER EVER EVER EVER be changed or any kind of exception. It’s called GAMETHROWING for a reason.

Dev approved.

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
Oh and by the way @RopeStringFace ^ THIS is a Developer

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: í42-Xblade
item.description:
RopeStringFace:

Player’s only have allegiance to them self. Thus, game throwing is doing something that you know will cause yourself to lose, not your faction.

This is false – NEUTRAL players only have allegiance to themselves. Not Blue Dragon, where your allegiance is to your faction. This goes against both your objective and lore. If you are a Noble and caught doing this, you will likely be hit with a banhammer for gamethrowing, so I urge you not to ~

However, if you are neutral and want to be converted, go for it – that’s perfectly acceptable.

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
there will be no exception
“I choose to join this evil faction” is gamethrowing
it just is
this will NEVER change
gamethrowing has no exceptions
you are either blatantly throwing the game or you are not
there is no grey area
there is no middle ground
leaving the BD for the evil team is GAMETHROWING and it will remain that way for the rest of the game’s life

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:

No, I’m a very experienced player who happens to talk a lot in the Discord and have been asked this question by countless people in the past.

I talk a lot in discord, too.

ThePlex:

There will never be exceptions to Gamethrowing.

Fine, if you REALLY think that more options in the game lowers it’s worth, I will change it.

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
No, I’m a very experienced player who happens to talk a lot in the Discord and have been asked this question by countless people in the past.

If you want confirmation, I will happily ask Xblade or Boslof, a mod or even @JammySplodge who has already said practically the same thing, say it again for you.

There will never be exceptions to Gamethrowing.

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
I’m sorry, are you a developer? Or can you see the future? The game is in ALPHA. I see no reason as to an exception to a rule made in alpha cannot be added to the final game.

Also, it’s not changing the rules; it’s adding an exception

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
No, the rules for Gamethrowing will NEVER EVER EVER EVER be changed or any kind of exception. It’s called GAMETHROWING for a reason.

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
ThePlex:

Actually, if the Nobles are asking/trying to be converted, that is game-throwing, because they’re hurting their factions chances at winning/survival. This was heavily discussed. As long as you’re in Blue Dragon, you must always be Pro-Blue Dragon. You can’t go around being like “Hey, could you convert me?”

Clearly, if the brotherhood is added into the game, this rule would be given an exception. The game is in alpha; thus the rules are open to change.

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
But you said yours wasn’t superior! Therefore mine clearly is!

Read full topic

item.description:
I disagree

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
Mine is superior though

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
ThePlex:

Well, for one, I was going to use mine in a future custom FoL, So go ahead and rename yours then

Okay, let me rephrase. Only one of the brotherhoods can be in the game; I do not necessarily think mine is superior, I am merely adding an idea to the mix of ideas that is the forums. It is better to provide people without multiple paths for the game and allow them to show interest in one over the other rather than just have one idea for everything.

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
RopeStringFace:

For example, it is not game throwing for the nobles to try and get converted, as the cult/unseen is significantly stronger with the nobles, and thus the noble might believe they have increased chances of winning if they attempt to get converted.

Actually, if the Nobles are asking/trying to be converted, that is game-throwing, because they’re hurting their factions chances at winning/survival. This was heavily discussed. As long as you’re in Blue Dragon, you must always be Pro-Blue Dragon. You can’t go around being like “Hey, could you convert me?”

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: Jazz
item.description:
RopeStringFace:

Player’s only have allegiance to them self. Thus, game throwing is doing something that you know will cause yourself to lose, not your faction.

False
Gamethrowing is going against the win condition of your faction
Asking “convert me convert me” in the chat is classed as gamethrowing

Read full topic

item.title: (deleted) the brotherhood
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
JammySplodge:

explain to me how this isn’t gamethrowing

If you really need an explanation, think of it this way: Player’s only have allegiance to them self. Thus, game throwing is doing something that you know will cause yourself to lose, not your faction. For example, it is not game throwing for the nobles to try and get converted, as the cult/unseen is significantly stronger with the nobles, and thus the noble might believe they have increased chances of winning if they attempt to get converted.

Read full topic
